poem:
"From Tabloid Tides"

Pecker, like an albatross,
circles stories in tabloid gloss;
two fish from different schools
in New York's swirling media pools.

Unsung puppeteer of scribes,
With every reveal, the tide subsides;
In the theatre of power, quiet and sly,
Under the inky American sky.

Democracy, stilled bird on a wire,
Watches on with gaze as quiet as mire.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "David Pecker, Trump’s ‘eyes and ears’, to resume testimony in hush-money trial The former tabloid publisher David Pecker will continue testimony at Donald Trump’s New York criminal trial on Thursday, following his testimony earlier in the week. Pecker, the former chief executive of American Media, which publishes the National Enquirer, testified that he used his position to help Trump kill negative stories that threatened his campaign.
